com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java

Class MesosClientBuilder<Send,Receive>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java.MesosClientBuilder<Send,Receive>
  • Type Parameters:
    Send - The type of objects that will be sent to Mesos
    Receive - The type of objects that are expected from Mesos

    public final class MesosClientBuilder<Send,Receive>
extends Object
    Builder used to create a MesosClient.

    PLEASE NOTE: All methods in this class function as "set" rather than "copy with new value"

      • mesosUri

        @NotNull
public @NotNull MesosClientBuilder<Send,Receive> mesosUri(@NotNull
                                                                   @NotNull URI mesosUri)
        The URI that should be used to connect to Mesos. The following segments of the URI are used:
        • hostname
        • port
        • username
        • password
        • path
        Parameters:
        mesosUri - Fully qualified URI to use to connect to mesos.
        Returns:
        this builder (allowing for further chained calls)

      • processStream

        @NotNull
public @NotNull MesosClientBuilder<Send,Receive> processStream(@NotNull
                                                                        @NotNull Function<rx.Observable<Receive>,rx.Observable<Optional<SinkOperation<Send>>>> streamProcessing)
        This method provides the means for a user to define how the event stream will be processed.

        The function passed to this method will function as the actual event processing code for the user.

        The stream the user will source from is an Observable of Receives. With this stream source a number of functions can be applied to transform/interact/evaluate the stream.

        The output of this function is the users reaction to each event represented as an Observable<Optional<SinkOperation<Send>>>. If Optional.isPresent() the specified SinkOperation will be processed.

        For example, if you wanted to log all tasks that result in error: 

        
 events -> {
     final Observable<Optional<SinkOperation<Call>>> errorLogger = events
         .filter(event -> event.getType() == Event.Type.UPDATE && event.getUpdate().getStatus().getState() == TaskState.TASK_ERROR)
         .doOnNext(e -> LOGGER.warn("Task Error: {}", ProtoUtils.protoToString(e)))
         .map(e -> Optional.empty());

     return errorLogger;
 }
        Parameters:
        streamProcessing - The function that will be woven between the event spout and the call sink
        Returns:
        this builder (allowing for further chained calls)

      • build

        @NotNull
public final @NotNull MesosClient<Send,Receive> build()
        Builds the instance of MesosClient that has been configured by this builder. All items are expected to have non-null values, if any item is null an exception will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The configured MesosClient
